column1: Questions
column14: Answer 3

column1: A lightning Page is __________.
column10: A compact, configurable, and reusable element.
column12: A custom layout for creating pages in Salesforce.
column14: The new name for a SF page layout.
column16: A page you can access via a customer community.

column1: What can you build with the Lightning app builder?
column12: Apps optimized for a particular task.
column14: Simple, single-page apps with drill-down capability.

column1: Actions on a Lightning Page allow you to __________.
column10: Send e-mail, create a task, and create or update records.
column12: Send e-mail and delete or clone records.
column14: Clone records, add users, and assign permissions.
column16: Send e-mail, send outbound messages, and launch a flow.

column1: Use the data import wizard when __________. (Choose three.)
column10: You need to load less than 50,000 records.
column12: The objects you need to import are supported by the wizard.
column14: You want to schedule regular data loads, such as nightly imports.
column16: You don't need the import process to be automate.

column1: Use Data Loader when __________. (Choose three.)
column10: You need to load 50,000 to five million records. If you need to load more than 5 million records, we recommend you work with a Salesforce partner or visit the AppExchange for a suitable partner product.
column12: You don't need the import process to be automated.
column14: You need to load into an object that is not supported by the Data Import Wizard.
column16: You want to schedule regular data loads, such as nightly imports.

column1: What objects are supported by the Import Wizard?
column14: Accounts

column1: You can export data from Salesforce using any of the following methods except __________.
column10: Use the data Manager tool to manually request an export of all the data in your organization.
column12: Use the data Export wizard within SF to export data manually or automatically.
column14: Use the data loader client application.

column1: When using the Data Export Wizard to manually export data, you can only export data if __________.
column10: Your data doesn't include attachments, images, or documents.
column12: You've installed a client application to export the data.
column14: Enough time has passed since your last export.

column1: When scheduling automatic data exporting with the Data Export Wizard, you must specify all of the following except __________.
column14: Number of attachments
column16: Frequency, if your organization supports monthly exports

column1: If any of the triggered workflow rules result in another field update that's also enabled for workflow rule re-evaluation, a domino effect occurs, and more workflow rules can be re-evaluated as a result of the newly-triggered field update.
Recursive triggers may cause your organization to exceed its limit for workflow time triggers per hour.
When do you need to refresh a sandbox? (Choose two.)
column12: When modification have been made to the production organization.
column14: Anytime.
column16: When you are done making changes to it.

column1: Which of the following can you create safely in a production organization?
column14: Custom Apex Controllers for Visualforce Pages

column1: Which of the following are good ways to track changes in production? (Community and Correct Answer Mismatch)
column12: Use a change log request form.
column14: Check the setup audit trail every week.

column1: Ideally, who should be in charge of logging all changes in production?
column14: QA Engineer

column1: You've developed some new functionality in production, but there are concurrent development projects in a developer sandbox.What's the best way to make sure the changes in production and projects in development are both merged?
column12: Copy all of the sandbox metadata to a file system, then refresh the developer sandbox, and finally deploy all the metadata to the developer sandbox.
column14: Create a new sandbox, and then deploy from your developer sandbox to the new sandbox.

column1: When is it advisable to use a full-copy sandbox? (Community and Correct Answer Mismatch)
column10: For training users on new features.
column14: Performance and load testing.

column1: You have a team of developers who need logins to sandbox.What's the best way to give them access?
column10: Create them as inactive users in production.
column12: Have them login as one of the users in production.
column14: Create them as users in sandbox, then deactivate the same number of users in production.
column16: Use Developer Edition to log into sandbox.

column1: Standard picklist fields can be controlling. (Community and Correct Answer Mismatch)

Universal container has included its orders as an external data object into Salesforce. You want to create a relationship between Accounts and the Orders object(one-to-many relationship) leveraging a key field for account which is on both external object and Account.Which relationship do you create?
column14: Master Detail Relationship

column1: What can you build with the Lightning Components framework?
column14: Custom components that override and extend the Salesforce1 app.

column1: How is the Lightning Component framework different from Visualforce?
column10: The framework can be used to build mobile apps only.
column12: The framework is client-side centric, while Visualforce relies on server calls.
column14: They are both useful in building components, but Visualforce has a simpler markup.

column1: Which of the following descriptions about the Lightning Components framework is true?
column10: It uses JavaScript on the client side and Apex on the server side.
column12: It uses events to communicate data between components.
column14: It uses a stateful client and stateless server architecture.

column1: What is true regarding person accounts in Salesforce? (Choose two.)
column10: Person accounts do not have a "Parent Account" field.
column12: Person accounts do not have the Account Hierarchy feature.
column14: Person Accounts can be enabled in setup.
column18: Leads cannot be converted to Person Accounts.

column1: A custom app can include one or more custom tabs.What kind of custom tabs can be included in an application?
column14: Custom Object Tab

column1: Universal Containers are doing a deep analysis on their monthly sales data, and would like the sales revenue split as products sold per country.What would be the ideal report to address this need?
column14: Matric

column1: You are building a project mgmt app. According to the design given to you, a project must store info regarding the various functional modules under it. Each functional module must store info regarding responsibility assigned to each developer. Info about the responsibility must have info about the due date and status.What could be the most optimal model to achieve this?
column10: Create a Project object then Modules as a child object. Add Tasks to Modules.
column12: Create a Project then add Tasks to it. Define Modules as a field on Task.
column14: Create Project, Module, Responsibility as parent, child and grandchild objects.
column16: Create Project and Module objects then Responsibility as a junction object.

column1: What is not a capability of the lead object? (Choose two.) (Community and Correct Answer Mismatch)
column10: Standard or Custom fields can be mapped to fields in the Account, Contact and Opportunity objects as part of lead conversion.
column12: Leads can be grouped into queues.
column14: Leads can be automatically assigned to users or queues.
column16: Custom objects that have been related to a lead can be copied when a lead is converted to the account, contact or opportunity.

column1: Universal Containers is using SF to manage travel requests. They would like to enable managers to approve travel requests via e-mail.What is true regarding e-mail approval responses?
column10: Approvers must the "API Enabled" system permission.
column12: Approval Comments cannot be added in the e-mail response.
column14: Approvers must click a link in the approval e-mail.
column16: If the request is rejected, the approver must add the rejection comments directly in SF.

column1: You need to ensure that the value in a custom field "Source Country" is validated against the standard list of ISO countries that are valid for the particular type of order, when the order is saved.What is the best way to achieve this requirement? (Community and Correct Answer Mismatch)
column10: Create a validation rule using a CASE statement.
column12: Create a validation rule using the VLOOKUP function.
column14: Create a before trigger and validate the value using APEX code.
column16: Create an after trigger and validate the value using APEX code.

column1: When activating a page in the Lightning app builder, what declarative options are available? (Choose three.)
column10: Select a tab icon for the page.
column14: Set the tab visibility.
column16: Set the tab order in the navigation menu.

column1: SF can connect social profiles to all of the following objects except __________.
column14: Business Accounts

column1: You need to provide a way to invoke a custom report from the account detail page. The report should render values that are specific to the account in context.What are the best options? (Choose two.)
column14: Detail Page Links

column1: What external relationship requires a Salesforce ID in the external data?
column14: Lookup

column1: For an external object relationship, you can create an external lookup relationship.What type of object(s) can be the parent?
column14: Standard or External

column1: Which of the following sequences of milestones would represent a typical application lifecycle?
column10: Development, Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing, Staging, Product Migration.
column12: Development, User Acceptance Testing, Production Migration.
column14: Development, Training, User Acceptance Testing, Staging, Production Migration.
column16: Development, Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing, Regression Testing, Production Migration.

column1: Which Social Account features can be accessed from SF1?
column14: Facebook

column1: You have a requirement to ensure that if the discount field on an opp is greater than 30%, the record should be automatically submitted for Approval.Which of the following would help you meet this requirement? (Choose two.) (Community and Correct Answer Mismatch)
column14: Process Builder

column1: What is not true regarding relating Tasks and Events to other objects?
column10: Accounts are associated via the WhatID or AccountID.
column12: Leads are associated via the WhoID.
column14: Custom Objects are associated via the What ID.
column16: Assets are associated via the WhatID.
column18: Contacts are associated via the WhatID.

column1: Contracts must be approved before the status is set to Finalized.How can this requirement be met?
column10: Add a final approval action in the approval process to update a field on the contract and use a validation rule to check this field when the contract status is changed to Finalized.
column12: Use a trigger on the contract object to check the contract has been approved when the status is changed.
column14: Use Process Builder to check the contract is approved when the contract is edited and the status is set to Finalized.
column16: Add a validation action in the approval process to ensure the status is not set to "Finalized" before the contract is approve.

column1: What is true regarding changing the field type of a rich text area?
column10: It is not possible to change the field type of a rich text area.
column12: Rich text area fields can be converted but only to a long text area field type.
column14: Images in a rich text area are deleted when the field type is converted.
column16: Rich text area fields can be converted to a text area field type but data may be truncate.

column1: Universal Containers provides access to Salesforce for their sales, service and marketing teams. Management wants to ensure that when users log in, their home tab provides access to links and documentation that are specifically relevant to their job function.How can this requirement be met?
column10: Create separate home page custom components and layouts; assign to users by role.
column12: Create separate home page custom components and layouts; assign to users by profile.
column14: Expose specific elements within a home page custom component determined by role.
column16: Expose specific elements within a home page custom components determined by profile.

column1: Which capability allows an app builder to grant object-level access? (Choose two.)
column10: Assigning a user a Profile that allows Read access to an object.
column12: Assigning a user a Public Group that allows for Read and Edit access to an object.
column14: Assigning a user a Permission Set that allows Read and Edit access to an object.
column16: Assigning a user a Role that allows Read access to an object.

column1: Universal containers would like to use a chatter group for their mergers and acquisition team to collaborate on potential new projects. This group should not be visible for non-members to see or join, and can be accessed by invite only.Which chatter Group type should the app builder recommend?
column14: Public Group

column1: Which statement is true when defining a Create custom action for the Contact object? (Choose two.) (Community and Correct Answer Mismatch)
column10: The create action will ignore field requirements.
column12: The create action can pre-define Contact field values.
column14: The create action allows a user to select a record type.
column16: The create action will respect validation rules.

column1: Universal Containers allows users to create standard reports on demand.What are two considerations users should be aware of when creating a new report? (Choose two.) (Community and Correct Answer Mismatch)
column10: Users can require that child objects exist for parent records using a cross filter
column12: Records will be available in the report regardless of security permissions
column14: Reports created from standard report types are available to all users
column16: The report type determines the types of records and fields that will be available

column1: An app builder wants to prevent users from creating new records on an account related list by overriding standard buttons.Which two aspects should be considered before overriding standard buttons? (Choose two.)
column10: Standard buttons that are NOT available for overrides can still be hidden on page layouts.
column12: Standard buttons can be changed on lookup dialogs, list views, and search result layouts.
column14: Standard buttons can be overridden, relocated on the detail page, and relabeled.
column16: Standard button can be overridden with a VF page.

column1: What are two reasons to create unmanaged packages? (Choose two.)
column10: Deploying from a Developer Edition environment.
column12: Publishing an application for sale on the AppExchange.
column14: Distributing upgradeable components to other Salesforce orgs
column16: Distributing open-source projects on the AppExchange.

column1: Universal Containers uses a custom object to track expense reports. They would like to automatically post updates on a record's feed whenever an expense report has been approved.What social feature can be used to accomplish this?
column14: Auto-response rule

column1: A Manager at Universal Containers has requested that a custom text field be converted to a picklist in order to promote better data hygiene.Which two actions should be considered before changing the field type? (Choose two.)
column10: Changing a field type will remove existing field history.
column12: Field reference will be removed in Visualforce pages.
column14: Existing list views that reference the field may be deleted.
column16: All data should be backed up before converting a text field.

column1: Which of the following are types of access within an organization? (Choose three.)
column14: Field

column1: What of the following are general types of actions available in Salesforce? (Choose four.)
column14: Log a Call ג€" log a call and it is recorded as a task
column16: Custom ג€" requires visual force page
column20: Delete ג€" permanently remove a record

column1: Which of the following are types of developer sandboxes environment types in Salesforce? (Choose four.)
column14: Partial Copy

column1: Which permission is required to install and uninstall packages from Salesforce AppExchange?
column14: Manage Package Licenses.

column1: Which of the following statements are true about Record IDs? (Choose two.)
column14: The 18 character ID is case?sensitive

column1: What is the maximum number of master-detail lookup relationships allowable per object?
Which three options are available for assigning access to Lightning Pages using Lightning App Builder? (Choose three.)
column14: Role and subordinates

column1: What standard Chatter actions (Post, File, Link, Poll, and Thanks) appear on the user profile page, regardless of the actions in the User page layout? (Choose three.)
column14: Poll

column1: What language is used to query Salesforce for specific information?
column14: SQL

column1: Which two of the following are supported actions for the Global Actions Menu? (Choose two.)
column14: Post to a Chatter feed
